intro: Homalium crassipetalum, commonly known as the broad-petioled hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five broad, waxy petals. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation in natural habitats.
